original_solution_mapping.L1: He made $600.00 mowing yards, $250.00 for his birthday, $150.00 selling items and $150.00 doing odd jobs so he made 600+250+150+150 = $<<600+250+150+150=1150.00>>1,150.00

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 456.
    Returns: the amount Chad will save.
    """
    # L1
    mowing_yards_income = 600.00 # made $600 mowing yards
    birthday_income = 250.00 # received $250.00 for his birthday/holidays
    selling_games_income = 150.00 # made $150.00 by selling some old video games
    odd_jobs_income = 150.00 # another $150.00 doing odd jobs
    total_income = mowing_yards_income + birthday_income + selling_games_income + odd_jobs_income

    # L2
    savings_percent_text = 40 # saves 40%
    savings_percent_decimal = 0.40 # saves 40%
    amount_saved = total_income * savings_percent_decimal

    # FA
    answer = amount_saved
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He made ${mowing_yards_income} mowing yards, ${birthday_income} for his birthday, ${selling_games_income} selling items and ${odd_jobs_income} doing odd jobs so he made {mowing_yards_income}+{birthday_income}+{selling_games_income}+{odd_jobs_income} = $<<{mowing_yards_income}+{birthday_income}+{selling_games_income}+{odd_jobs_income}={total_income}>>{total_income}
He made ${total_income} and will save {savings_percent_text}% so he saves {total_income}*{savings_percent_decimal} = $<<{total_income}*{savings_percent_decimal}={amount_saved}>>{amount_saved}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He made $600 mowing yards, $250 for his birthday, $150 selling items and $150 doing odd jobs so he made 600+250+150+150 = $<<600+250+150+150=1150>>1150
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He made $150 and will save 40% so he saves 150*0.4 = $<<150*0.4=60>>60

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'odd_jobs_income' (value: 150.0) was used instead of 'total_income' (value: 1150.0).
